content: orna-mitts 2023 by elena maltseva december 2023 orna-mitts 2023 by elena maltseva pictures by knittintheblues jenturm and zwulli on ravelry materials  us size 1 2 5mm set of 5 dpns tapestry needle  any fingering or light fingering yarn for one ornament about 50-55 yards 46-50m  polyfill stuffing polyester fiber fill gauge 8 stitches x 10 row knitting in the round in 1 x 1 after blocking exact gauge is not important notes 1 size with recommended yarn needles and gauge the ornament will be about 9 ½ 24 cm in circumference after stuffing larger needles and thicker yarn will produce a larger ornament 2 stranded colorwork follow the charts from right to left catch longer float using preferred method catching floats is not essential for this project but it will help maintain the gauge make sure to secure any loose yarn ends inside the ornament weaving in the ends is not needed orna-mitts 2023 by elena maltseva december 2023 symbols apply to colors indicated in the chart knit 2 together slip slip knit make 1 in indicated color no stitch for ornaments 7 & 8 only knit in background color see detailed instructions above the ornament chart the photo below is provided for reference ornament cast on 16 stitches using disappearing loop technique round 1 of the chart with the color indicated in the chart below are a few links to videos and tutorials to help with cast-on if needed disappearing loop cast on video https //www youtube com/watchapp=desktop&v=xgy4m4fje3o crochet method https //www youtube com/watch v=mifq29dq6zu or alternatively you can use pinhole cast-on method https //blog tincanknits com/2012/05/25/pinhole-cast-on- tutorial/ tutorial orna-mitts 2023 by elena maltseva december 2023 pinhole cast-on video https //www youtube com/watch v=ahu7swcjyjk distribute onto 4 needles 4 stitches per needle place marker for the beginning of the round continue with the chart rounds 2-39 follow the charts from right to left the decreases start in round 28 it would be a good time to turn your ornament inside out and secure any loose yarn ends after round 34-35 i recommend you begin stuffing your ornament pack it tightly for a nice firm ball continue adding more stuffing as you go after round 39 break your yarn leaving a long tail about 10 to be used as a hanging loop then using a tapestry needle pull the yarn through the remaining stitches tighten and secure the end form a loop of desired length and secure the yarn end at the top base of the ornament hide the remaining yarn end inside the ornament trim the end if needed alternatively you can reduce the number of stitches to 3 and knit a 3-stitch i-cord to desired length to be used as a loop for your ornament your ornament is ready enjoy orna-mitts 2023 by elena
